## Get DBEM grid on data


```{r}

grid_dbem <- function(shapefile, dbem_grid, out = "df"){

  dbem_grid <- sf::st_as_sf(dbem_grid,
                            coords = c("lon","lat"),
                            crs = 4326)

  # if supplied a grid will rasterize
  if(inherits(shapefile, "sf")== FALSE){

    shapefile <- sf::st_as_sf(shapefile,
                              coords = c("lon","lat"),
                              crs = 4326) 
  }else{

    # Make sure shapefile is in the same coordinate system
    shapefile <- shapefile %>%
      st_set_crs(4326)
  }

  # Merge both
  if(out == "sf"){
    merge_grid <- sf::st_join(dbem_grid,
                              shapefile,
                              join = st_intersects)
  }else{
    merge_grid <- sf::st_join(dbem_grid,
                              shapefile,
                              join = st_intersects) %>%
      as.data.frame() %>%
      select(-geometry)
  }
  return(merge_grid)
}



```

to_dbem <- function(data,yr,var,forcing){
  
  x <- data %>% 
    filter(year == yr) %>%
    ungroup() %>% 
    select(variable)
  
  
  name <- paste0(data_path,"to_dbem/COBALT2/",forcing,"/",var$dbem_name,yr,".txt")
  write.table(x, file=name, sep="\t", col.names = F, row.names = F)
 gc() 
}

# Manually extract u data cus is too big 

```{r}

nc <- nc_open(file_path)

# Extract relevant information
lon <- ncvar_get(nc, "lon")
lat <- ncvar_get(nc, "lat")
time <- ncvar_get(nc, "time")
uo <- ncvar_get(nc, "uo", start = c(1, 1, 1, 1), count = c(-1, -1, 1, -1))  # Extract only the first Z layer

# Close the NetCDF file
nc_close(nc)

# Get the time in years
years <- as.integer(time / 12) + 1901

# Create a data frame
df <- expand.grid(
  Longitude = lon,
  Latitude = lat,
  Year = years
)

# Add the Sea Water X Velocity data
df$Velocity <- as.vector(uo)

# Print the resulting data frame
print(df)


df %>% 
  filter(Year == 2000) %>% 
  group_by(Longitude,Latitude) %>% 
  summarise(mean = mean(Velocity, na.rm = T)) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_tile(
    aes(
      x = Longitude,
      y = Latitude,
      fill = mean
    )
  )
```
